title: macOS Sierra 10.12 (16A323) bootable USB (DMG File)
description:
How to do info.. 

Format Your USB Flash Drive:
1. Insert the USB flash drive into your Macâ€™s USB port.
2. Launch Disk Utility, located at /Applications/Utilities/.
3. In the list of drives attached to your Mac, select the USB flash drive device. In my case, itâ€™s called â€œ16 GB TDK Stickâ€.
4. Click on â€œEraseâ€
5. Name the formatted usb drive â€œUntitledâ€
6. Select Mac OS X Extended (Journaled) from the Format dropdown menu.
7. For Scheme choose â€œGuid Partition Mapâ€
6. And click â€œEraseâ€


Now the USB flash drive is prepared you can Restore "Install macOS Sierra.dmgâ€ to your USB flash drive.

1. Open Disk Utility
2. In the menu left of the â€œDisk Utilityâ€ window select the USB Drive â€œUntitledâ€.
3. In the top menu bar from â€œDisk Utilityâ€  click â€œEditâ€ / â€œRestoreâ€
4.Click on â€œImageâ€ and go to the DMG File with macOS Sierra named â€œInstall macOS Sierra.dmgâ€ and click â€œOpenâ€
5. Now click â€œRestoreâ€ 

(To install macOS Sierra restart your Mac with â€œaltâ€ hold  and select your USB flash drive)

Done..

Known problem:
image need to be scanned before restore?
Unmount the dmg file named â€œInstall macOS Sierra.dmgâ€ (if it is mounted :)
Go to the top menu of â€œDisk Utilityâ€ window and select â€œimagesâ€ and then â€œScan image for restoreâ€
Go to the â€œInstall macOS Sierra.dmgâ€ and click open.
Now you are able to restore the dmg-file to your usb drive.

Enjoy
